import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

#Ignore warnings
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.17f70444:
#Codes by ask9 https://www.kaggle.com/arbazkhan971/indians-vs-world/notebook

def random_colors(number_of_colors):
    color = ["#"+''.join([random.choice('0123456789ABCDEF') for j in range(6)])
                 for i in range(number_of_colors)]
    return color
source.c8b463cc:
from pywaffle import Waffle
import random

gender = df["What is your gender ?"].value_counts()

fig = plt.figure(
    FigureClass=Waffle,
    rows=5,
    columns=20,
    values=gender,
    colors = random_colors(len(gender)),
    title={'label': 'Gender Distribution', 'loc': 'left'},
    labels=["{}({})".format(a, b) for a, b in zip(gender.index, gender) ],
    legend={'loc': 'lower left', 'bbox_to_anchor': (0, -0.4), 'ncol': len(df.groupby("Select your age group ?").get_group('20- 30 years old .')), 'framealpha': 0},
    font_size=30, 
    icons = 'child',
    figsize=(12, 5),  
    icon_legend=True
)

from pywaffle import Waffle

age = df["Select your age group ?"].value_counts()

plt.figure(
    FigureClass=Waffle,
    rows=5,
    columns=10,
    values=age,
    title={'label': 'Age Distribution', 'loc': 'left'},
    labels=["{}({})".format(a, b) for a, b in zip(age.index, age) ],
    # Set the position of the legend
    legend={'loc': 'upper left', 'bbox_to_anchor': (1, 1)},
    dpi=100,
    colors = ["#ffa31a", "#D17200", "#9c5400", "#763f00", "#422400", "#a88732"]
)
plt.show()

source.09db63cc:
fig,ax = plt.subplots(1,1, figsize=(8,8))
degree = df.groupby(["Select your age group ?", "Select the weight category you belong to ?"]).size().unstack()#.fillna(0)
degree = degree.div(degree.sum(axis=1), axis=0)
sns.heatmap(degree, cmap='Spectral_r')
source.bbe22f42:
from category_encoders import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression, Ridge
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, MinMaxScaler, MaxAbsScaler

cols_selected = ["How likely are you to spread Awareness that Genes play Important role in Obesity?"]
ohe = OneHotEncoder(cols=cols_selected, use_cat_names=True)
df_t = ohe.fit_transform(df[cols_selected+['ID']])

#scaler = MaxAbsScaler()
X = df_t.iloc[:,:-1]
y = df_t.iloc[:, -1].fillna(df_t.iloc[:, -1].mean()) / df_t.iloc[:, -1].max()

mdl = Ridge(alpha=0.1)
mdl.fit(X,y)

pd.Series(mdl.coef_, index=X.columns).sort_values().head(10).plot.barh()
source.7cb48191:
from category_encoders import OneHotEncoder

#scaler = MaxAbsScaler()
X = df[df.filter(regex='How likely are you to spread Awareness that Genes play Important role in Obesity?', axis=1).columns]
y = df.iloc[:, -1].fillna(df.iloc[:, -1].mean()) / df.iloc[:, -1].max()

mdl = Ridge(alpha=0.1)
mdl.fit(X,y)

pd.Series(mdl.coef_, index=X.columns).sort_values().head(10).plot.barh()
source.4a72f15c:
col_ad = "Select the weight category you belong to ?"
df.loc[df[col_ad] == 'Overweight', col_ad] = 'overweight'

men = df[df.loc[:, "What is your gender ?"] == 'Male'] #Linhas com sexo Masculino
men_state_mean = men.groupby("Are you aware that genes play a role in Obesity ?")['How likely are you to spread Awareness that Genes play Important role in Obesity?'].mean() #Média Masculina por região

woman = df[df.loc[:, "What is your gender ?"] == 'Female'] #Linhas com sexo Feminino
woman_state_mean = woman.groupby("Are you aware that genes play a role in Obesity ?")['How likely are you to spread Awareness that Genes play Important role in Obesity?'].mean() #Média Feminina por região

menxp = men.groupby("What do you think,which of the following cause Obesity?\n(Select all options that apply)")['How likely are you to spread Awareness that Genes play Important role in Obesity?'].mean()
womanxp = woman.groupby("What do you think,which of the following cause Obesity?\n(Select all options that apply)")['How likely are you to spread Awareness that Genes play Important role in Obesity?'].mean()
source.f5780eb8:
plt.barh(men_state_mean.index, men_state_mean.values, color='blue')
plt.barh(woman_state_mean.index, woman_state_mean.values, color='#f5005a')

plt.xlabel("How likely are you to spread Awareness that Genes play Important role in Obesity?")
plt.ylabel("Are you aware that genes play a role in Obesity ?")

plt.title("Obesity Survey")

plt.legend(['Male', 'Female'])
